text: A soldier, during a war, fed his horse, his companion of effort and danger, barley. But after the war, the horse was used for servile work and to transport heavy bags, being fed only with straw. When a new war was announced, and the trumpet sounded, the owner of the horse packed it, armed himself, and rode on it. But the horse, exhausted, fell every moment. And she said to her master, Go better with the children; for thou hast turned me from a horse to an ass. How do you want to turn a donkey into a horse now? In good times, we must prepare for bad.
title: El caballo y el soldado
author: nan Esopo
